para_sentences.para_0: At this point, you should be able to answer all of the following questions.
para_sentences.para_1: If you are unsure of any of these answers, take some time to review the course materials. Feel free to post questions into the General Q&A Discussion. Next week's lessons will be easier if you have invested in mastering this week's learning outcomes.
para_sentences.para_2: Check the Explorations and Task List in the Week 9 - Overview to review learning materials and make sure you have completed all required activities for this week.

ul_0: Explain P  NP  NP-Complete and NP-Hard complexity classes
What is meant by P  NP  NP-Hard and NP-Complete?
What are some examples of P  NP  NP-Complete and NP-Hard problems?
What do we mean when we say a problem is NP-Complete?
What do we mean by reduction?
Explain how a problem is shown to be NP-complete
What is meant by a reduction in polynomial time?
How do we reduce one problem to another one?
How do we show a problem to be NP-Complete?
Implement a polynomial-time heuristic algorithm to solve an NP-hard problem
What is meant by a heuristic?
What are some strategies to implement NP-hard problems?
